summary: Current water quality metrics are stable but show signs of temperature fluctuation and slight pH increase.

insights.recommendation: Monitor pH closely; consider adding pH stabilizers if it continues to rise.
Maintain current feeding and water change schedule to keep TDS levels optimal.
Ensure water temperature remains within optimal range for tilapia (24-28°C); consider heating if it drops further.

extended_notes:
Last 7 days overview:
• pH avg/min/max: 7.035 / 7.008 / 7.106 (trend: down)
• TDS avg/min/max: 330.32 / 307.8 / 339.7 ppm (trend: up)
• Temp avg/min/max: 25.162 / 21.5 / 29.62 °C (trend: down)

Actions (if needed):
• pH: keep ~6.6–7.2; calibrate probe with 7.00/4.01; adjust slowly.
• TDS: seedlings ~200–500 ppm; higher OK for mature plants; water-change to reduce.
• Temp: hold in target band for your fish/plants; heater/chiller/aeration as needed.
